item.title: Andy Warhol @ Christie's: By the Book
item.description:
Andy Warhol @ Christie's: By the Book

Following the traveling exhibition Warhol by the Book this month's sale continues the exploration of Andy Warhol's lifelong interest in publishing and the art of the book, featuring numerous studies for well-known books, such as In the Bottom of My Garden and Wild Raspberries , as well as a rare Lips book.

item.title: Clo'e Floirat, 'You broke my art', 2015, Watermill Center Summer Benefit Auction 2016 | Artsy
item.description:
Clo'e Floirat, 'You broke my art', 2015, Watermill Center Summer Benefit Auction 2016 | Artsy

Clo'e Floirat's charming drawings comment on contemporary cultural events, often with a satirical edge. Her subjects have included the London Olympics, the Battersea Power Station, The Pritzker Architecture Prize, and monumental public art projects by Anish Kapoor, Daniel Buren, and Ilya and Emilia Kabakov.
